item.title: Krita 5.0.2
item.description: Hot on the heels of Krita 5.0.0, we’re releasing the first bugfix release of Krita 5! It’s 5.0.2 because if you upload a beta with the version number 5.

item.title: Krita 5.0 released!
item.description: Krita 5.0 is here! This is a huge release, with a lot of new features and improvements. Some highlights: The way Krita handles things like brushes, gradients and palettes, as well as tagging, has been completely revamped.

item.title: Krita 4.4.8 Released
item.description: This is strictly a bug fix release. There are two changes: we fixed an issue with saving a .kra file with an embedded palette, which was broken leading to dataloss, and, for Windows, support for fractional HiDPI display scaling is now disabled by default.

item.title: First Beta for Krita 5.0 released
item.description: Today, the Krita team releases the first beta for Krita 5.0. Krita 5.0 is a major release, with a lot of new features and a lot of changes.

item.title: Krita 4.4.7 Released
item.description: This is strictly a bug fix release. The most important reason for this release is a fix for a performance regression in Krita 4.

item.title: Krita 4.4.5 Released
item.description: One last bugfix release before Krita 5.0! We found a nasty bug on MacOS, and while we’re on the cusp of finishing up Krita 5.

item.title: Krita 4.4.3 Released
item.description: Today, we’re releasing Krita 4.4.3. This is strictly a bugfix release. We spend two beta’s worth of testing trying to make this a really stable release, because from now on, we’re focusing on Krita 5!

item.title: Krita 4.4.2 Released
item.description: Today, the Krita team has released Krita 4.4.2. With over 300 changes, this is mainly a bugfix release, though some key new features, too!

item.title: KSeExpr 4.0.0 Released!
item.description: Today, we’re happy to announce the release of KSeExpr 4.0.0! KSeExpr is the fork of Disney Animation’s SeExpr expression language library that we ship with Krita.

item.title: Krita 4.4.1 Released
item.description: Despite an extra-long beta period during which we got awesome feedback from our community, 4.4.0 was released with several regressions, that is, bugs that weren’t present in 4.

item.title: Krita 4.4.0 released!
item.description: Today, we’re releasing Krita 4.4.0! Only a little later than we had planned, this is the next feature release of Krita!

item.title: Krita 4.3.0 Released
item.description: Three months after the release of Krita 4.2.9, we’ve got a major new feature release for you: Krita 4.3.0! We’ve spent the past year not just fixing bugs, even though we fixed over a thousand issues, but have also been busy adding cool new stuff to play with.

item.title: Krita 4.2.9 Released
item.description: Today we’re finally releasing Krita 4.2.9! It’s been one of the most complicated releases we’ve ever attempted. When we updated the version of Python that’s embedded in Krita, scripting broke on Windows.

item.title: Krita 4.2.8 Released
item.description: The Krita team is pleased to announce another bug fix release of Krita 4.2: Krita 4.2.8.Â Part of Krita’s core team is now working on rewriting the way Krita loads and saves resources like brushes or gradients.

item.title: Krita 4.2.8 Beta
item.description: We had to skip the October release because we were working on a bunch of issues that took longer to resolve than planned, but that means that this release has more fixes than ever.

item.title: Krita 4.2.7 Released
item.description: Today, we’re releasing the sixth bug fix release of Krita 4.2. As discussed in our development update, we intend to release a few more monthly 4.

item.title: Let's Test Krita 4.2.7 Beta!
item.description: We’re almost ready for a new release of Krita, with lots of bug fixes! So, please help with testing. As with 4.

item.title: Krita 4.2.6 released
item.description: A bit later than expected, because of a regression found during beta testing, we’re releasing Krita 4.2.6. Over 120 people have participated in the beta test survey, so this is something we’ll repeat for the next release.

item.title: Krita 4.2.5 Released
item.description: We found that Krita 4.2.4 still had a bug handling shortcuts when certain tools were active. We’ve worked hard to fix that bug as quickly as possible, and as a consequence, we’re releasing Krita 4.

item.title: Krita 4.2.4 Released
